intro: Strobilopanax macrocephalus, commonly known as the large-headed strobilopanax, is a member of the Araliaceae family and is native to Southeast Asia. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 20 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and alternate, palmately compound leaves. The plant produces distinctive, large, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbellate inflorescences, which are followed by spherical, red-brown fruits. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
